intro: Brassica oleracea var. scotica, commonly known as Scottish kale, is a cultivar of the cabbage family characterized by its sturdy, dark green leaves. It is native to the British Isles and is well adapted to cool, maritime climates. The plant typically grows to a height of about 50–80 cm, with thick, lobed leaves that are often coated in a fine layer of wax. It is a hardy biennial that can be harvested in its first year for leaves or allowed to flower and set seed in the second. This variety is valued for its nutritional content and resilience to harsh weather conditions.
